item.description:
One of the true gifts in a busy life is an extended period of silence, a
time when we intentionally turn our attentions away from the rush of
responsibilities and commitments, images and messages, and quietly attune
ourselves to an inner space. However, in a world so completely focused on
action it is sometimes challenging to move from responding with immediate
reactions into a space of silence and reflection. In silence we deepen our
awareness and understanding of ourselves, others and situations. We can
expand our thinking from limited to unlimited which leads to innovation and
creativity. Through silence we can also enter into a relationship with the
Divine through which we receive spiritual power and can become instruments
to serve others. Through the power of silence our greatness is revealed to
ourselves and to others. Anyone who has spent time in a retreat setting
knows the challenge of carrying back into life and work the deep sense of
inner peace and power they have touched while away from the world.

No two people approach the transition into silence in the same way. For some
it begins with visualization; for others it is something more tangible -
running, sitting in front of a candle, or playing a musical instrument.

Silence is a subtle language that connects us to one another through the
eyes, with a smile, or a gesture. Fluency in this subtle language calls for
our ability to observe the small details of life.

In silence I discover my innate qualities, the qualities that are intrinsic
to who I am. Here in silence I touch my eternal self, and I come to trust
this deepest essence. The experience of recognizing my intrinsic and unique
qualities increases my own power to receive. In silence I touch my inner
strength and experience trust, faith, safety, beauty, worthiness. It is from
this base of inner strength that my actions evolve.
